title: Mastering Your Email Inbox (工作/效率)
english: Email can be a powerful tool, but for many professionals, it has become a constant source of distraction and anxiety. Learning to manage your inbox efficiently is key to regaining control over your workday.

The **'Two-Minute Rule'** is highly effective: If an email can be read and responded to in two minutes or less, do it immediately. If it requires more time, either schedule a dedicated time slot to handle it later or delegate it.

Another essential strategy is to check your email only at specific times, rather than leaving your inbox open all day. Try checking it three times a day—morning, midday, and afternoon—to minimize interruptions.

Also, be ruthless with organizing. Unsubscribe from unnecessary newsletters and use folders or labels to categorize messages you need to keep. A clean inbox reduces mental clutter and allows you to focus on high-priority tasks.
chinese: 电子邮件可以是一个强大的工具，但对于许多专业人士来说，它已成为持续分心和焦虑的来源。学会有效地管理收件箱是重新获得对工作日控制权的关键。
**“两分钟规则”**非常有效：如果一封电子邮件可以在两分钟或更短的时间内阅读和回复，请立即处理它。如果需要更多时间，要么安排一个专门的时间段稍后处理，要么委托给他人。
另一个重要的策略是只在特定的时间查看电子邮件，而不是一整天都让收件箱开着。尝试每天检查三次——上午、中午和下午——以尽量减少干扰。
此外，要毫不留情地进行整理。取消订阅不必要的电子报，并使用文件夹或标签对你需要保留的信息进行分类。一个干净的收件箱可以减少精神上的混乱，让你专注于高优先级的任务。

vocabulary.meaning: adj. 无情的，毫不留情的
